ygData.subject: MirrorWriterProcessor and windows
ygData.msgSnippet: St.Ack, I think that there is a problem with MirrorWriterProcessor (1.8) and windows. URLs that has spaces before and/or after a slash / , are not written to

St.Ack,

I think that there is a problem with MirrorWriterProcessor (1.8) a=
nd
windows. URLs that has spaces before and/or after a slash "/", are not
w=
ritten to the disk, because the directories cannot be created.

As an examp=
le, if Heritrix downloads the URL "http://domain.com/string
%20/%20with%20/=
spaces.html", the file is not written to disk, and the
following error is t=
hrown:

 java.io.IOException: Can not mkdir
C:\heritrix-1.8.0\.\jobs\ajob-2=
0060608013228376\mirror\domain.com\string
\ with \spaces.html
	at
org.archi=
ve.crawler.writer.MirrorWriterProcessor$DirSegment.addToPath(MirrorWriterPr=
ocessor.java:951)
	at
org.archive.crawler.writer.MirrorWriterProcessor.dirP=
ath(MirrorWriterProcessor.java:407)
	at
org.archive.crawler.writer.MirrorWr=
iterProcessor.uriToFile(MirrorWriterProcessor.java:657)
	at
org.archive.cra=
wler.writer.MirrorWriterProcessor.uriToFile(MirrorWriterProcessor.java:542)=

	at
org.archive.crawler.writer.MirrorWriterProcessor.innerProcess(MirrorWr=
iterProcessor.java:362)
	at org.archive.crawler.framework.Processor.process=
(Processor.java:103)
	at
org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.processCra=
wlUri(ToeThread.java:306)
	at org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.run(T=
oeThread.java:153)

There is no problem if the spaces are in other places (=
not rigth
before or after a slash).

This problem occurs in windows, but no=
t in GNU/Linux.

Thanks very much, 

tizo
